title: Variable Swap and Unpacking
description:
Practice multiple assignment and variable swapping techniques.

Part 1: Use multiple assignment to create variables:
- x, y, z = 10, 20, 30

Part 2: Swap x and y values using Python's elegant swap

Part 3: Unpack a coordinate tuple (100, 200) into variables a and b

Print results after each operation.

Expected output:
Initial: x=10, y=20, z=30
After swap: x=20, y=10
Coordinates: a=100, b=200
starterCode:
# Part 1: Multiple assignment
# TODO: Assign x=10, y=20, z=30 in one line

print(f"Initial: x={x}, y={y}, z={z}")

# Part 2: Swap x and y
# TODO: Swap x and y values

print(f"After swap: x={x}, y={y}")

# Part 3: Unpack coordinates
coordinates = (100, 200)
# TODO: Unpack into variables a and b

print(f"Coordinates: a={a}, b={b}")
solution:
# Part 1: Multiple assignment
x, y, z = 10, 20, 30
print(f"Initial: x={x}, y={y}, z={z}")

# Part 2: Swap x and y
x, y = y, x
print(f"After swap: x={x}, y={y}")

# Part 3: Unpack coordinates
coordinates = (100, 200)
a, b = coordinates
print(f"Coordinates: a={a}, b={b}")
hints: Use multiple assignment: x, y, z = 10, 20, 30
Swap in Python: x, y = y, x (no temp variable needed)
Print using f-strings as shown in expected output

testCases.description: Should swap x and y correctly
